channel.title: Where should I promote my music?
channel.description: There’s a lot of different places that allow promotion of tracks, but what are the best ones to use, suggest discord’s, Forums, etc.

item.title: Where should I promote my music?
item.dc:creator: Mr_Mooo
item.description:
The self promo I do is posting it on here, posting it on instagram (and advertising my music instagram account on my main instagram account because I have more followers on that) and once on discord.

Read full topic

item.title: Where should I promote my music?
item.dc:creator: El1011
item.description:
and if it’s stolen or bass boosted/ made into earrape then it’s much harder to do so. It’s a guaranteed bet that more people would know the meme than the actual song. either way, at that point that’s how everyone else is going to see you, as a meme, not an artist (As @NotMiles previously stated)

item.title: Where should I promote my music?
item.dc:creator: stereofield
item.description:
I am aware of a couple people who like to think that I use fake plays services to get good stats, if that’s you then please read this post

Polar:

Also, repost trades are very very very helpful, especially repost trading with people outside of the Auxy community, because then your music reaches a further audience.

item.title: Where should I promote my music?
item.dc:creator: NotMiles
item.description:
Sure you’ll get exposure, but people may not take you seriously afterwards.

I’d rather be known as a great musician instead of “that meme song guy”

item.source: Where should I promote my music?

item.title: Where should I promote my music?
item.dc:creator: El1011
item.description:
that might promote your song, but doesn’t mean people are gonna know what it is. I actually didn’t know the track was called Mine until i just looked it up. Just associated it with the meme and nothing more. Same with Lucid Dreams, tho i have heard it before, i dont tend to associate the meme with the song, they feel like 2 separate things to me. Kinda like Ali-a’s intro track. You know it, but not so much the actual track (well at least i dont). Only meme i’ve actually known the original song for recently is Crab Rave
Also people prob just gonna rip your track more so than finding the artist and getting the full thing.

Read full topic
item.source: Where should I promote my music?

item.title: Where should I promote my music?
item.dc:creator: XLXK
item.description:
The most powerful tool to gain music awareness is through memes. To put this into perspective, Bazzi’s “Mine” went from someone finding a song , a meme, and putting the two together. The meme later gained attraction, also with the fact that the song isn’t that bad. The song is now played on radios, Spotify, concerts, everywhere basically! Another song is Lucid Dreams By Juice WRLD. You can see how largely popular the songs has grown. My point is explained, but most of these were more related to the trap genre, if your fine with lofi that would work too. This is just a brief summary of the Meme Music Genre pretty much, Hope this helps!

Maybe I will create forum about this later.

Read full topic
item.source: Where should I promote my music?

item.source: Where should I promote my music?

item.title: Where should I promote my music?
item.dc:creator: Polar
item.description:
Promote in literally every music discord you can. To find some, go through the announcement channels and you’ll find plenty of links to follow.

Also, repost trades are very very very helpful, especially repost trading with people outside of the Auxy community, because then your music reaches a further audience.

Read full topic
item.source: Where should I promote my music?

item.title: Where should I promote my music?
item.dc:creator: NotMiles
item.description:
Post branding, distribution and marketing tips (links & embeds only) Branding & Distribution
Similar to the Post writing and production tips thread, this thread is for us to share found videos, articles, insights, analysis, etc… about branding, releasing, distribution, marketing, building audiences, profile/career promotion and development. …basically, the stuff that happens once you’ve finished the music. Anyone here can add a post, for any genre. (I’ll move some relevant posts from the other thread here.)

These people probably know more than aUstin and I
